sub_topic: Finding the area of a sector of a circle.
message_1: A sector of a circle has a central angle of 60° and a radius of 8 cm. Find the area of the sector.
message_2:
To find the area of the sector, we can use the formula:

Area of sector = (Central angle/360°) × π × radius²

In this case, the central angle is 60° and the radius is 8 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Area of sector = (60°/360°) × π × (8 cm)²

Area of sector = (1/6) × π × 64 cm²

Area of sector = 64π/6 cm²

Area of sector = 32π/3 cm²

So, the area of the sector is (32π/3) cm².
